page.title: 11THE VILLAGE HALL,INKBERROW.
page.content: Inkberrow has a village hall.It is on the edge of the village.It plays a very important part in village life. In 1922 the first Horse Show was held in Inkberrow to raise money for a village hall.The land was bought off a local farmer.The building of the village hall started in 1948.It has been extended and now has a large hall,kitchen,storerooms,smaller room, showers and cloakrooms.The Inkberrow Community Council run the hall and are responsible for raising funds to meet running expenses.There are 26 groups who use the hall.Some are sporting clubs,Guides,Brownies,Women's institute,Drama,Playgroup,Mother and Toddler,Flower Club,Horticultural Society,and Sunshine Club.It is also used monthly as a Health Clinic. Playing fields and swings.a slide and climbing frame are popular outside.
